subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Europe's Empty Churches: Why the West Left God
description: A 60-second lesson on Europe's Empty Churches: Why the West Left God.

hook.text: Only 5% of Brits attend church weekly. Cathedrals are museums now. Europe was Christian for 1,500 years. What happened?

buildup.text: After World War II, European church attendance collapsed. Wealth, education, and welfare made religion optional.

discovery.text: Charles Taylor calls it the 'secular age.' Belief went from default to one option among many. God became optional.

twist.text: But Europe didn't become anti-religious. It became indifferent. Nobody fights God. They just stopped caring.

climax.text: Europe's story is unique. Globally, religion is growing. The West is the exception, not the rule.

punchline.text: Europe didn't reject God. It just stopped caring. Indifference, not war.

quiz.question: Why did religion decline in Europe?
options: Wealth, education, and welfare made religion feel less necessary
